description:
A card game based on a simple turn by turn system, on your turn turning over cards to find villagers, to gain points, but if you draw Pumpkin Killer Man, you're dead! Try to save the people of Fallville, and get out alive. This game includes many different ways to play and extra rules to add mechanics to the base style of play.

—description from the designer

Buy, sell, and trade all kinds of crazy mushrooms on your way to victory in this exciting, strategic, and family-friendly card game.

—user summary

Shroom Shroom is a super fun and strategic card game about collecting and trading all kinds of crazy mushrooms. Players take turns selling, buying, and trading mushrooms to add to their collections. Try and collect different combinations and families of mushrooms to earn points.

Choose your cards wisely because you can only have up to ten shrooms in your collection at a time. Some cards have special powers that allow you to develop fun or cruel strategies against each other. The thing that makes Shroom Shroom even more awesome is trading. You can trade anything with anyone at any time during the game. While you're waiting for your turn, make some trades with other players to help build up your collection.

When the cards run out, everyone adds up their points and the person with the best shroom collection wins.

—description from the designer

In Sci-Fi Return, you must enter a damaged space station and recover some information.
The station is in danger of falling apart and various dangerous creatures have escaped and are roaming the facility.

This is a sequel to Sci-Fi Escape but is a stand alone game you don't need anything else to play it.

Ideal for 28mm figures but you can use whatever comes to hand.

—description from the publisher

Elfs vs Dwarfs is a solo game in which you can play either the Dwarves or the Elves trying to hold out until relieved.

A simple and easy to play game with lots of random options to make each game different.

—description from the publisher

Bagration 1944 is a solo game where you command a Russian infantry platoon trying to clear out some German forces left behind after your forces rapid advance.

Simple to play.
Will work in any scale as long as the figures are individually based, lots of options to keep the game varied each time it is played.

—description from the publisher

Vikings is a solo game where you command a group of Vikings cut off and trying to make it to safety while being pursued by lots of angry Anglo Saxons.

A simple game to learn and play but should be lots of fun with plenty of variable factors to make each game different.

Requires individually based figures ideally 28mm but any scale will do.

—description from the publisher

Dwarven Beer is a solo game in which you have to transport a wagon full of beer across an area infested with goblins who also want the beer.

You command a small group of Dwarfs plus the beer wagon the goblins are controlled by the rules.

The game has plenty of random factors to keep it different every time you play, easy to learn and fun to play.

—description from the publisher

Players take turns rolling three special six-sided dice with three golf balls, "hook", "slice", and "trap". Each player start with three coins. Each dice roll determines what happens to the coins, either pass a coin to the left (hook), pass a coin to the right (slice), put a coin in the center (trap), or keep the coin (golf ball). Game ends when only one player is left with coins, and he/she wins the coins in the center.

—user summary

The exploration of space was carried out primarily by large corporations which soon found out that valuable resources were few and far between and soon they were in conflict over the few good systems. 
After some years things settled down leaving a number of what had become in effect nations looking greedily at each other’s possessions.
The year is 2264 and border skirmishes are common, the discovery of a string of new valuable systems would set off a war that would destroy many of these new nations between the stars.
This war was known as the War of Expansion.

War Between The Stars is a game of starship combat. 
It uses a couple of ships or play larger games with whole fleets, lots of ship designs to use as well as a design system to create your own. 
There are also a few sample scenarios to get you started and as an introduction to the War of Expansion.

The rule are simple and easy to learn but the use of special features allows for the construction of unique fleets that each has its own advantages.

Sequence of Play:

     Starting with whoever has the most ships, the players move alternate ships until all ships have been moved.
     Conduct firing, all of which is considered to be simultaneous. 
     All ships may try to repair damage then 
     start the next move


—description from the rulebook

As the Earth ran out of resources humanity became more and more dependent on the huge amount of resources available in the asteroid belt. The mining of these was left to a number of corporations that soon started fighting over the most valuable asteroids.
The game represents these encounters between groups of spacefighters played on a hex grid using either counters or model ships normally 2-3 ships/player but larger games are possible and using multiple players will help to model the chaotic nature of these combats.

A set of rules for fighter combat in the asteroid belt.
Needs a hex grid to play and some 10 and 6 sided dice.
You could use counters or models to represent the ships .

The ships are armed with cannons and missiles with limited ammunition so games will come to a natural end rather than continuing until all of one side is destroyed.

Some sample ships are to start with but you can easily design your own.

Turn Sequence:

     Roll to recover control
     Set ship speed unless out of control
     Choose to fly evasive or normal
     If not evasive or out of control can roll to repair damage
     Move out of controlships
     Move evasive ships
     Move all other ships
     Missiles take effect
     Firing with cannons
     Firing with missiles


–description from the rulebook

A simple game representing a small group of Chindits trying to reach their base after a mission deep in enemy territory.

The game does not use figures all you need is a piece of paper a pen and a pack of playing cards including the jokers.

Quick and fun to play a game usually lasts less than 10 minutes.

—description from the publisher

Return to the arena for the second insane deck-building game from the award-winning Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards universe! The action is even more intense, the carnage is more vicious, and the table-flipping anger is even more epic.

Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Annihilageddon 2 – Xtreme Nacho Legends is a standalone game, but it's also compatible with Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Annihilageddon, the first deck-building game in the Epic Spell Wars universe!

Gjorn is a fast, quick-to-learn but very tactical card game for 2-4 players. You will win by making tactical decisions. You need to get ahead of your opponent to dominate the battlefield.

There are five different kinds of cards and each card has its own effect.

There are also 2 kinds of tokens coins and fame. Some of the card effects make you lose coins, but you can never lose fame.

You win by collecting coins and fame. Both are worth 1 point

Card effects:

Axe: Capture 3 coins

Shield: Opponents lose 2 coins

Bow: Capture 1 coin and make your opponent lose 1 coin

Horn: Earn 1 fame

Runestone: Win every tie.

Starting the game:
You shuffle all the cards together and every player gets 7 cards. There are 15 rounds now.

In each round, players place a card face down in front of them and reveal it at the same time.

Players compare all their cards in front of them. And whoever has the most cards of a type, or a tie but most runestones, get the effect of the card.

Who has the most points at the end wins.

—description from the designer

Once Upon a Crime is a party game based on the new "criminal storytelling" mechanic that combines deduction, bluffing and "StoryTelling" in a crime scenario. A player invents a crime by connecting a suspect, a motive, a weapon and a location using the cards on the table and reveals a single clue: who died. The other players must deduce the correct combination by choosing among 4 suspects, 4 motives, 4 weapons and 4 locations. But one or more of the players might be criminals, and they will try to trick them without getting caught.

Players play as a miner, a teacher, a shipworker, an engineer, a shopkeeper, or a company executive. The objective of the game is to not become unemployed. The game board is a circular track with Pay As You Lose and Survival cards placed in two separate decks in the center.

Players take turns rolling dice and moving a Monetarist Fiend playing piece around the board, landing on either a job space or a PAYL space. If it lands on a job space, players pay tax to the Cosmetic Economic Policies Fund according to each occupation provided in a table in the rules booklet. If it lands on a job space that is the player's own, then he/she is paid by the other players. If a player lands on a PAYL space, he/she takes a PAYL card and performs the actions on the card.

—user summary

Can you ceep a calm mindset?

The game within the trend! Cooperativly experience the atmosphere of an ESCAPE ROOM within your own living room. In this challenging game you cooperativly try to solve riddles and find hidden hints. It´s a race against time; you only have 60 minutes to solve and master all puzzles. Your game-master - THE CHRONO DECODER - is counting down mercilessly, provides background sounds for intensified atmosphere and sometimes even provides precious hints.

At this game you win or lose together. Every player has to try his best to reach the mutual goal - nevertheless you will only succeed whit teamwork. Those who never completed an ESCAPE ROOM will realise, how quick an hour full of adrenaline can pass.

A Gest of Robin Hood is a board game about the daring adventures of Robin Hood and his brave band of Merry Men as they struggle against the oppressive Sheriff and his cruel Henchmen. The game is set against the historical backdrop of peasant revolt, feudal taxation, and rural banditry in 12th-century England, but also emphasizes the mythology and folklore that has grown up around the Robin Hood tales.

One player takes the role of Robin Hood and the Merry Men, stealing from the rich and encouraging peasant disobedience, while the other player takes the role of the Sheriff of Nottingham and his Henchmen, tasked with maintaining peace and collecting taxes for Prince John. Both players will make use of Plots, Deeds, and Events to recruit and manoeuvre their forces, influence or control the peasant population, raise funds and collect taxes, and rob innocent travellers and greedy merchants alike, all in pursuit of their opposed ideals of Justice and Order.

Victory is determined by the position of the red Royal Favour cylinder on the Justice/Order Track. If the final Royal Inspection is reached and no winner has yet been determined in this way, then victory goes to the player whose side the cylinder is currently on.

A Gest of Robin Hood is the second game in the Irregular Conflict Series, further adapting the COIN system to depict peasant revolts, feudal tax collection, and outlaw activities in late 12th century medieval England. Transposing one of GMT’s most popular systems into a simpler format and a more approachable setting makes A Gest of Robin Hood perfect for newcomers to wargaming. At the same time, it also offers a tight challenge for more experienced wargamers who can enjoy a tense asymmetric duel in under an hour.

In May 1942, 18 American crewmen scuttle their US Navy minelayer ship based in the Philippines to prevent it from falling into the hands of the invading Japanese forces. Using a 36-foot US Navy motor launch, the 18 sailors, led by Lieutenant Commander John Morrill (player), begin their 2,000-mile journey through Japanese infested waters in an attempt to reach Darwin, Australia.

Escape from Corregidor is a Print & Play historical solitaire board game of danger and survival. As their leader, you will attempt to lead your 17 men to safety 2,000 miles away in Australia. The dangers you and your men will possibly face include dehydration, starvation, hostile natives, tropical diseases, poisonous snakes, inclement weather, and Japanese enemy aircraft and ships.

Game components include navigation mats, calendar mat, a tables book, and a counter sheet with various counters to location and status of the boat along it's route.

The player moves his boat game counter across the various navigation mats during his journey.

—description from the designer

Add 15 more cards to Munchkin Starfinder to make the terrifying Swarm even more vicious . . . and silly! Make sure to carry your Swarm Repellent to avoid the Head Louse!

This is an expansion for Munchkin Starfinder. It is not a stand-alone game.

Based on the Starfinder Roleplaying Game from Paizo Inc.

—description from the publisher

Challenge your friends to a very special version of your favourite board game! The official UNSW Business School Monopoly features prominent campus locations for some UNSW-themed fun. Let the games begin!

In Bug Hunt, players want to collect matching bugs to complete their collection.

At the start of the game, they construct the bug shrub and fill it with all manner of bugs. Then, they reach in through the shrub's tunnel opening to try to grab theirs — but they have to watch out for the other players' bugs as well as the white ones, who are known to bite any hand that tries to grab them. The first player to finish their collection wins.

A new violent, mature and Visceral roleplaying board gameboard game set in the World of Darkness.

Intended for solo play as well as up to four players, Werewolf: The Apocalypse — RETALIATION takes place in Yosemite Valley, following a deadly battle that left your pack all but decimated. With only a full lunar cycle to recover, rebuild your Caern, and prepare for your final revenge against Wyrm entities, your choices will weigh heavily upon the fate of your characters.

The game includes immersive branching scenarios, intense combats, mesmerizing investigations, beautiful minis, and a profound roleplaying experience.

—description from the designer

This game is closely related to KFC's Assano.
Just like KFC's Assano, this Bigger version is a promotional game.

The box contains the same cards as KFC's Assano, but expands them with the following:

This version has a few extra cards compared to the Multi-Lingual version, namely:

     7 Cards with number 6-9, plus 1 "draw-1" card, in the color yellow.
     7 Cards with number 6-9, plus 1 "draw-1" card, in the color blue.
     7 Cards with number 6-9, plus 1 "draw-1" card, in the color green.
     7 Cards with number 6-9, plus 1 "draw-1" card, in the color red.


As this is a Dutch only version, the rules are only in Dutch, but on two cards instead of one.

Gameplay and rules are basically the same KFC's Assano.

—user summary

G’schwind is a funny song board game for the young and old, for lovers of pop music, folk music and children's songs.

400 word cards
1 hourglass
1 board
4 gramophone figures

Rules
The player draws one or more word cards within the given time and he is allowed to move one or more fields with the gramophone figure for each song performed. However, only if the word from the word card appears in the performed song and the melody is recognizable. The word on the drawn word card may also be part of a word family in the lyrics. For example "survive" and "survivor"
A total of 4 significant icons are drawn on the board game as special hurdles or obstacles: Whistling, Humming, Double Time and "I Sing For You".

—description from the designer

Our intrepid author Paige Turner is back!  In Paperback Adventures, you get to play as the protagonist in one of Paige's wild brainstorming sessions. Conquer a menagerie of pulp novel characters in this solo deckbuilding word game.

Just like in the original game Paperback — and the follow-up game Hardback — you will build your own deck of cards throughout the game, and those cards will have letters to help you spell words every turn. But in Paperback Adventures, instead of testing your wordsmithing wit against other players, you will use your words to defeat a series of AI enemies in "roguelike" fashion.

Paperback Adventures is a solo-focused game. It was designed from the ground up as a strategic, highly-replayable solo word game. There are also additional gameplay variants for cooperative play between two players. There are three playable characters that have different strengths and playstyles.

The core box is NOT A COMPLETE GAME! One Character Box required (Ex Machina, Damsel or Plothook)

You are the city planner over a large construction site. Show your friends that you can build the best city by earning the most victory points in 1 year (12 rounds). Earn victory points by gathering resources to construct buildings, catching fish to show sustainability for large populations, utilizing warehouses to create jobs, gathering gold to speed up production, and connecting major roads to complete road plans. Whoever has the most victory points at the end of the 12th month wins the game!

Do you like building things? Are you a creative person? Do you enjoy solving puzzles? Loads of Roads combines the joy of being creative with the satisfaction that comes from solving an intense puzzle. Whether you are a game geek or the casual player, Loads of Roads has something to offer. A beginner will walk away feeling proud of the city they built, while an intense gamer will stay awake at night thinking about their next strategy. It is very easy to learn, but nearly impossible to master because of the clever game setup. No two games will ever be the same.

A 2 player game of love and time travel...

You have lived a life of time distorted. The days you live are not in chronological order. One day you might be 5 years old, learning to tie your shoe for the first time. You sleep, and awake the next day as a young adult, at a job you suddenly know (or remember?) how to do.

It’s exciting! Never a dull moment, every sensation feels fresh and new. You get to experience firsts again and again. There is no such thing as monotony.

But recently, your days have all had one thing in common. One person is always there. Even though you are living your relationship out of order, it is clear that you will love this person dearly (or perhaps you already do).

For the first time, you feel a desire to change this time-hopping life of yours and live linearly. You want to experience life with this person, to build and share the same memories together.

So now begins a conscious choice. You have to stabilize, to break free of the chaotic whirlpool of time you have found yourself tossed about it, and find calmer waters. You’re not even sure if it’s possible.

As you drag yourself towards a linear timeline, you can feel it take a toll on your body and mind. You’ve never lived time in order before, can you even handle it?

So many questions, so many unknowns. But what you do know is that you have to try, you really, really want to try. And you can sense that they do too.

Play this game when you want to feel very soft, share emotional intimacy, and maybe cry a little.

"Playing the game"


     On your first turn, flip the card your token is already on face up
     On subsequent turns, move your token to an adjacent (not
     Read the prompt that corresponds to your card, answering the questions it poses
     Note down any affects on your Time Sickness. Some cards will give you Time Sickness, others will heal it. 
     The aim of the game is for both players to move their tokens to the Joker card, stabilizing themselves and gaining the ability to live time linearly.

Offshore rig, DeepWell•4, has blown out and the rupture is spilling crude oil into the ocean at an alarming rate! Your response team must work together, using your individual talents to avert an ecological disaster, one which threatens to contaminate marine life and devastate the ecosystem. The situation is dire and escalating by the minute, so there is no time to waste.

     Contain the oil flowing from the rig
     Remove what oil you can from the waters
     Rescue the marine animals


The world is watching. The fate of the coast is in your hands!

This fully cooperative game features a 4-way dice tower as the oil rig, which randomly drops oil dice onto the four quadrants of the game board. In this respect, the game is a reverse tower defense game, as players sail the perimeter trying to push back and contain the oil, remove dice from the water and save the sea life.

Communal resource cards are chosen by the team before the game begins and are then powered for use by either removing 3 oil dice from the game or saving a full set of 6 marine creatures.  Weather dice complicate matters adding new challenges for the round that restrict movement, drop more dice or increase the cost of operations. It takes coordination and teamwork to win, as new oil dice are dropped at the beginning of every turn and the number of oil dice dropped increases over the course of the game.

If the team can accomplish all three objectives on their WIN Condition card and remedy any potential losing conditions on the board by the end of a given turn - they win. Otherwise the game will end when the 60 dice from the bag are exhausted or they are unable to correct one of the three losing conditions.

—description from the publisher

Devote yourself utterly to the way of the buddha, and mummify yourself to help in achieving salvation for all of man-kind!

In this three-phase rummy game, try to collect a combination, discard that combination you just got, then discard all your cards.
Farbsprung is a Pachisi-like game with color dice instead of normal dice. Accordingly, the path for the figures is designed with colour dots. Counting is not yet necessary here.

In the Das Spiel der Werbung ("Game of Advertising"), the players each run an advertising agency with which they have to collect 50 medals as quickly as possible.

The players move their figures across the board with 2 dice and can move onto budget fields or event fields. On "budget" fields they receive a "budget" card and thus medals if they get through the "pitch" (answer a question correctly, solve an advertising task, etc.) and can pay the presentation costs. On event fields, cards are drawn and you can win or lose money and medals.

The questions included in the game require a basic knowledge of the advertising industry.

—user summary

As the new foreman, you have a specific goal: get those buildings constructed! Only to do that you have to find ways of maximizing your efforts with the Construction Vehicles, which end up all over the yard and depending when you use them, they will provide different bonuses.

Plot out the construction of your Buildings by collecting materials, even off turn. Each Building has a special power and can only be constructed once. Often points are gained at times when Buildings are constructed, which can lead to intriguing timing to maximize the value those buildings will earn.

Take care to use abilities to shift dice, even to rows they wouldn’t normally be in, finding the Bulldozer in the Dump Truck’s row can show of some truly versatile play! Plus dice remain where they are until they are used, only then are they rerolled. Did you set yourself up for a great play later on or will your opponents pounce on it first?

Under Construction is a game of utilizing Construction Vehicles to gain their favor and also resources to erect buildings. Buildings create an engine to further utilize the Construction Vehicles. In the end, the player who did both the best will walk away victorious. Watch for clever combos and Vehicles moving outside of their lanes to create chaos and new opportunities.

—description from the designer

A clone of "cards against humanity"  adapted to Catalan culture.
—user summary

An insulting game not suitable for children, figs and thin-skinned people.
The mechanics of the game are simple. A player draws a red card and reads the question. The rest of the players have to answer with the funniest yellow card they have. 

Un joc d’ofendre no apte per a nens, figaflors i gent de pell fina.
La mecànica del joc és simple. Un jugador tira una carta vermella i en llegeix la pregunta. La resta de jugadors han de respondre amb la carta groga més divertida que tinguin. I així fins al final dels dies.

—description from the publisher

Mermaid Mayhem is an exciting card based adventure for ages 8 and up! Take your mermaid battle squad on a danger filled treasure hunt. Grow your party and punish your foes as you race to claim the most treasure.

On their turn they will play cards from their hand to build their team then draw from the deck to find upgrades, treasures, and encounters. Players can also choose to defeat a boss once strong enough. The game ends when no more bosses can be defeated.

The player with the most treasure at the end of the game wins.

—description from the designer

The Kingdom Series Board Game follows the books of The Kingdom Series and The Knights of Arrethtrae very closely. A familiarity with the books will lead to a quick understanding of how the game is played.

The Kingdom of Arrethtrae is divided into thirty territories. At the beginning of the game, each territory is occupied and controlled by the Dark Knight and his Shadow Warriors. The mission is to retake as many of the territories for the Prince as possible before He returns on His ship as He journeys from the Kingdom Across the Sea. It will take Him ten rounds of play to reach the city of Chessington. Once the Prince reaches the docks at Chessington, the game is over. Every knight has the opportunity to retake one territory on each turn by battling against Shadow Warriors and possibly creatures. If a knight is able to retake a territory on his turn, he will acquire a precious resource or weapon to help fight future battles. A knight will usually not know the scope of the battle until he or she enters the territory and draws a battle card. The knight may face a single Shadow Warrior, multiple Shadow Warriors, creatures, and even a Stronghold. Weapons and resources will be necessary to retake a territory with creatures or Strongholds.

One to six players can play the game, but there will always be six knights represented on the board. For example, if there is only one player, he will control all six of the knights. If there are three players, each player will control two knights. For four or five players, one or two of the players must control two knights or those knights can be controlled by all players jointly. All six knights are encouraged to work together and strategize on how to recover as many territories as possible. Only through teamwork and keen strategy is a team of knights successful. Victory occurs in varying degrees, for each territory and its people are precious to the Prince. Ultimate victory occurs when all thirty territories are recovered before the Prince arrives.

—description from the publisher

Clay poker chips are stacked on a central, circular wooden board in 3 stacks of 16 chips of randomly mixed colors (5 colors, RED, BLUE, GREEN, YELLOW, BLACK).  Traditional values are generally assigned to the colors (i.e. RED = $5), but some color values can change for particular players based on various bonuses awarded.

Players take turns with opportunities to TAKE one poker chip for themselves from the top of any one stack or GIVE one to another player from the top of any one stack.  The latter action is only constructive for winning because on the GIVER's next turn, it awards him the bonus of taking exactly 2 chips from the top of any combination of stacks (or 2 from the top of the same stack); once per round they may even take 3 chips in the same manner.

Play proceeds until rounds equal to the number of players are played. Each round, values are tallied; the final accumulative highest grand total tally wins.

This is mostly a strategy game with not much luck, except for the initial set-up that offers a bit of luck; this is balanced by letting each player start a round in a game.

TOMA: Take;  DACA: Give  (in Spanish)

Goal of the Game: 
Players need to work together to get a perfect ENDing. Then convince the City God (Cheng Huang) to agree it.

A player plays as Yuelao (Chinese Cupid) to be the host.

Phase 1: Day Patrol
There are memories in 13 rooms. Players owns limit joss sticks to explore different 13 rooms to get clue. If players explore 8 rooms, they will goes to phase 2.

Phase 2: Night Watch
Players has to discuss with each other to get own clue in 60 minutes.

Phase 3: Trial
There are different characters for each player. Player will provide information from previous phase to get the final ENDing.

Goal of the game:
Player has to solve the puzzle to get the final truth!

There are different clue in 10 post cards. Player has to use the cooper coins and compass to get corresponding words or pictures. If you can go through to 10th Puzzle, and figure it out, you win the game

You are a crop farmer in the modern world trying to make a living in an ever-fluctuating market. You’re primarily a Wheat farmer but are now experimenting with other crops as the market has become saturated. You've narrowed your choices between Rice, Oats, Corn, Barley or Quinoa to add to your harvest in hopes of getting ahead of the market and to turn a better profit. However, the competition is experimenting with the same philosophy. Can you outthink your neighbors and develop a strategy that yields a better return? Or will you fall victim to your poor investment decisions?

Supporting up to 9 players, Agronomy is the deck building game that combines the reality of life on the farm with real world economics. Each player begins the game with a deck of 8 wheat and 2 random specialty crops. Every round, players take their turns simultaneously and reveal their hands to determine the market value of each crop. Investing in equipment cards will either increase the quantity of your crops or decrease the cost of purchasing additional crops. Market cards will directly affect the value of your crops and in some cases your opponent's. Research cards will either disrupt your opponent's game play or enhance your own. With 24 different cards to choose from, players will randomly choose 3 cards from each category to create a different and exciting challenge each game. Each player has a common goal of being the first to reach $60, but every dollar spent takes you further away from goal. So invest wisely.

—description from the designer

"Cudgel Duel: Franco's First Counterstrikes at the Ebro, Aug-Sep 1938" is a FREE Print and Play wargame; the first one depicting the second phase of the Clicmatic Battle of the Ebro. The battle composed of a series of vicious counterattacks that ended, after much blood spilling, pushing the Republican army to the left bank of the river it had crossed 4 months before.

The game is a Battalion level simulation of the battle, played on a hexagonal grid with hexides spanning 500 meters and 8 hour turns. The turns consist of successive divisional activations and separate air and administrative phases. The scenarios depict five of the bloody counter-offensives that took place between August and October 1938.

Status markers and air operations are handled in separate charts. Maneuver, morale, intelligence, enemy reaction and divisional assets play a significant part in the battle management. Combat resolution is interactive and fluid, maximizing unpredictability.

The game includes a set of rules, one scenario booklet, one A2 map, three air operations charts, ten corps asset charts, and three, two sided, counter sheets. One six sided die and, optionally, two opaque cups are also required.

—description from the designer

The players are supposed to spoon out of the plate as quickly as possible all the vegetable pieces that can be seen on the card that has just been turned over. But it's not as easy as it sounds, because the spoons have joints and bend exactly when you don't need them, making you lose the carrot you just picked up very quickly. For smaller children who want to play along, you can also push the spoon together and thus make the handle immovable.

—user summary;;

Doobidoo makes everyday life a party and the party even more festive. There are no occasions that do not get more fun and happier with Doobidoo. Like music is all that is required. But are you also quick-thinking, an undiscovered Monet or do you sing like a god? Then you will love Doobidoo.

Collect letters by scoring points on the different squares on the board. Sing, draw, answer questions,
think fast and guess. Do not hesitate to let go and set the tone - that's the way to success. It made that
first manages to form the word DOOBIDOO with its letter tiles wins!

In turn, each player must mime a subject, trying to make the other players guess it. The youngest player starts by drawing a subject-card and turning the spinner that will determine, according to the color of the card, which subject he has to mime. If, for example, the color pink comes out, he will have to mime the word in the card that corresponds to the color pink. If the emoji comes out, he can freely choose one of the six subject-words. He repeats the process by drawing an action card and turning the spinner again, which determines the action to be mimed (for example: THE LION PAINTS).
At this point he proceeds with the mime (one or two minutes of time can be set, at the competitors' choice).
The game stops either at the end of the time or when a contestant guesses both the subject and the action he is performing. In the latter case, both the mime and the first contestant to guess win a token. If no one guesses, no tokens are awareded. The game then continues in the same way counter-clockwise from the last one who mimed. The winner is whoever earns 5 tokens first.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Tautotì is a creative writing game based on tautograms, a puzzle game that consists in forming sentences or compositions whose words start with the same letter. The youngest player draws an inspiration card and, immediately after, a letter card. He places them in the center of the table, clearly visible to all players. Then turn the hourglass: each player has the task, in the time of the hourglass, to write on his blackboard a meaningful sentence containing at least one subject represented in the inspiration card. One point is counted for each word in the sentence that begins with the letter drawn. One point is subtracted from this sum for each word that does not have the required initial. If, while composing a sentence, you come to a net of 5 words with the same initial, the score doubles. The game continues with another round of play (the player to the right of the last one draws the inspiration card and the letter card, and so on...). The winner is the one who reaches, first, the score of 35 points (or more, as chosen by the players before starting the game).

“The Colossus is fast approaching to the Village! Someone must do something or there will be nothing left behind."

In the role of the Hero you must knock down the Colossus. To perform this feat you must climb through the levels of his body until you reach the sensitive point, his head, and deliver the coup de grace. To achieve this you must wisely manage your stamina, fatigue and vitality. Hurry! The Colossus is moving and the fate of everyone who loves you rests in your hands.

Overview
The Hero starts at ground level (level 0). Each turn you either attempt to climb to the next body spot or hold on to rest and recover. Then the Colossus will act, either attempting to shake off the Hero or advance towards the Village.

—description from the designer

The game continues until the Hero’s vitality reaches zero, the Colossus is killed, or the Colossus reaches the Village.

—user summary

In Somewhere Under The Rainbow, you take on the role of one of the tiny winged critters of Glistening Grove. As a loyal resident of this land, it is your sworn duty to partake in the mysterious process of creating colorful rainbows, using a rare and secret ingredient: the crystalline poop of a Unicorn!

Armed with an enchanted plunger, you will fly your way through piles of multicolored Unicorn Poop and gather precious pieces of feces to build stunning rainbows. At the same time, you’ll need to prepare as many delicious dishes for the Unicorn as possible, to make sure the supply doesn’t run out.

Gameplay: On your turn, you can decide to either "Gather Unicorn Poop" or "Visit the Village". When you Visit the Village, you must perform at least one of the following three actions in whatever order you like:


     Rainbow Maker: Trade Poop Tokens for Glitter Cubes by depositing at least 2 tokens of the same color into the tube of the Rainbow Maker. The more tokens you deposit at once, the more Glitter Cubes you receive in return.
     Market: Use the Glitter Cubes to buy Ingredients at the Market.
     Food: Earn Tasty Points by combining any two Ingredients to create a Food of a specific color to feed the Unicorn.


A rainbow is created once all six different colors of Poop Tokens have been deposited into the tube of the Rainbow Maker. The game ends when four rainbows have been created. Poop Tokens used to make rainbows throughout the game can score you valuable bonus Tasty Points at the end. The more tokens of one color that were used, the more bonus Tasty Points go to the player who has earned the highest number of Tasty Points from Food of that color during the course of the game. The player with the highest total number of Tasty Points wins the game, and is officially named the best Rainbow Maker in Glistening Grove!

—description from the designer

You are a God. You have been challenged by Zeus and Hera, rulers of Olympus, to take part in a race of epic proportions. With help from fabulous mythological creatures and all the quirky Gods and Goddeses in the Greek Pantheon, be the first to reach the highest peak of Mount Olympus, where eternal glory awaits!

Play as one of eight powerful Gods and Goddesses, each with their own Territory, special powers and gameplay style. Race across the gameboard, using a variety of card effects and advantages on your own Territory to turn the odds in your favour. Be the first player to reach Mount Olympus to win the game.

—description from the designer

HYKE is a poetic communication game in which you create senryÅ« — poems with a 5-7-5 syllable structure, typically about human foibles — in which someone at the table can identify the theme of your creation, but ideally not too easily.

To set up, players submit themes to a central pool, then you draw one of those themes at random, create a senryÅ« based on that theme, and invite others to identify the theme of your creation. Your score is the number of people who guess incorrectly before someone guesses correctly, so you want your poem to be both not too easy to understand and not too difficult to understand.

The game board is a grid of colored numbers (1-4) with intersecting lines between the numbers. Players take turns placing 4 rings each on the board, and then moving those rings to achieve a total of 10. To win the game, the four rings must be placed on four numbers of four different colors or 2 pairs of identical colors.

—user summary

The game board is a plastic six by six square grid which allows for the sliding of pieces. Players take turns placing their counters (20 each) on the board. Players are allowed to "shift" rows of counters to block their opponent's attempt to get 5 in a row.

The game is made in Hong Kong.
